awd_titl_txt: Presidential Young Investigator Award: Theoretical Physics
awd_abstract_narration: Research will be done on the theory of elementary particles,            and related areas of cosmology and astrophysics.                                        One focus of the work in particle theory will be the theory             of strings, in which the point particles of conventional particle               theories are replaced by extended objects having the form of tiny               strings.  The research in cosmology may include such topics as                  the cosmological origin of the baryon number, and that in astro-                physics such topics as the study of interaction of the magnetic                 monopoles with neutron stars.                                                           The research will be carried out by a highly-distinguished              young theoretical physicist who is one of the new Presidential                  Young Investigators for 1987.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
